work.summary: Worked remotely for MindModulations.com's owner, Gary Bense.
Summer time job making gift baskets for cruise lines and gift shops.
Worked on a sales team of 6 to provide guest with high price items and extended warranties. Left position to return to studies.
highlights: Worked with Logistics team in warehouse.
Worked closely with Asset Protection team.

volunteer.organization: United Way Of The Wine Country
highlights: Planted garden in John Reed Elementary School
Put together backpacks for school children that couldn't afford them at Agilent Technology.

awards.title: Oregon State Chess Tournament
awards.summary: Competed against each chess club in Oregon state. Double elimination tournament. 4th-12th Grade. 14 Wins and 0 Loses.

publications.name: Coupons
publications.summary: An article about the UPC and GS-128 barcodes and how they are made. Explores the interesting U.S laws around them. Original research.

publications.name: Database Notes
publications.summary: Notes taken from Codecademy.com's SQL course, combined with an "Introduction to Databases" course from Stanford streamed online.

publications.name: Java Notes
publications.summary: Notes taken from Oracle tutorials and a course taught at Berkeley streamed online.

publications.name: Original Xbox Security
publications.summary: A brief overview of the software and hardware security that prevented owners from hacking the console.

publications.name: C/C++ Notes
publications.summary: Notes taken while studying C/C++ and the different paradigms used in programming.

publications.name: SMS Bomber
publications.summary: Desktop application with full Graphical User Interface that logs into Gmail and sends text messages to a targets phone number. Can destroy older devices. Proof of concept. Built with HTML/CSS/JS/Python and PyQt.

publications.name: Facebook Event Page Invite Flaw
publications.summary: There is a limit for how many invites one account can send for each event.  However, if an account has a phone verified and an Android device is sending the request, a work around can be achieved.

publications.name: Dailymotion Account Project
publications.summary: Dailymotion.com is a video hosting service that is similar to Youtube. Users can upload their videos, and get a share of the ad revenue generated when said videos are viewed. The niche of the project is that Youtube requires several extra steps to enable monetization, while Dailymotion only ask that you verify the email account to the account. Cancelled due to fall of Dailymotions revenue systems.

publications.name: Original Xbox Game Installer
publications.summary: An article about a custom built application that ran on the Original Xbox video game console. The app would show a list of games released for the system, so that a title can be selected, downloaded to the hard drive, and installed into the games folder without the need for a PC. Built with Python 2.7 for XBMC4Xbox. My first project with a Graphical User Interface.

references.name: Jason Ford (linkedin.com/in/jasonhford/)
references.reference: You should be making at least $100,000 a year working at a high end tech firm.

references.name: Gary Bense
references.reference: You were an excellent employee. You fully automated most of our operations and increased sales by 300%. You really put Mind Modulations on the map! Revenue was at $1 million a year, amazing for such a small operation!
